      • checkPoint

        public void checkPoint​(LogCheckPointEvent logCheckPointEvent,
                       LogPosition logPosition,
                       Instant checkpointTime,
                       String reason)
                throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: CheckpointAppender
        Appends a check point to a log which marks a starting point for recovery in the event of failure. After this method have returned the check point mark must have been flushed to disk.
        Specified by:
        checkPoint in interface CheckpointAppender
        Parameters:
        logCheckPointEvent - a trace event for the given check point operation.
        logPosition - the log position contained in the written check point
        checkpointTime - time when checkpoint occurred
        reason - reason for checkpoint to occur
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was a problem appending the transaction. See method javadoc body for how to handle exceptions in general thrown from this method.

      • getCurrentPosition

        public long getCurrentPosition()
